text: Bosnia and Herzegovina is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, because of the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's eighth consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics. ==Athletics== Bosnian athletes further achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Amel Tuka |align=left|Men's 800 m | | | | | | |} ;Field events {|class=wikitable style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Qualification !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Distance !Position !Distance !Position |-align=center |align=left|Mesud Pezer |align=left|Men's shot put | | | | |} == See also == * Bosnia and Herzegovina at the 2020 Summer Paralympics ==References== == External links == Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Bosnia and Herzegovina sport
title: Bosnia and Herzegovina at the 2020 Summer Olympics
